paper_title.en: Genus one Birkhoff sections for the geodesic flows of hyperbolic 2-orbifolds
paper_title.ja: Genus one Birkhoff sections for the geodesic flows of hyperbolic 2-orbifolds

description.en: We construct genus one Birkhoff sections fo the geodesic flows of hyperbolic 2-spheres with n(>2) singularities.
description.ja: We construct genus one Birkhoff sections fo the geodesic flows of hyperbolic 2-spheres with n(>2) singularities.

paper_title.ja: Genus one Birkhoff sections for suspension Anosov flows
paper_title.en: Genus one Birkhoff sections for suspension Anosov flows

publication_name.ja: abstract of International conference "Geometry and Foliations 2013"
publication_name.en: abstract of International conference "Geometry and Foliations 2013"

paper_title.ja: Examples of Pseudo-Anosov Homeomorphisms with Small Dilatations
paper_title.en: Examples of Pseudo-Anosov Homeomorphisms with Small Dilatations

description.ja: For a closed orientable surface $\Sigma_g$ of genus $g\ge 2$, we give an upper bound for the least dilatation of pseudo-Anosov homeomorphisms of $\Sigma_g$. For this purpose, we construct a family of Birkhoff sections for a suspension Anosov flow. Birkhoff sections have been constructed by using cut and paste arguments for surfaces in 3-manifolds. But we construct them directly and then we obtain piecewise linear models of the first return mappings of the Birkhoff sections. These models enable us to investigate their dilatations explicitly, and we obtain necessary estimates.

paper_title.ja: Algebraic property of dilatation constants of piecewise linear structures of Anosov foliations
paper_title.en: Algebraic property of dilatation constants of piecewise linear structures of Anosov foliations

paper_title.ja: Deformations of PL-representations of surface groups
paper_title.en: Deformations of PL-representations of surface groups
Classification of exotic circles of PL+(S1)
paper_title.ja: Classification of exotic circles of PL_+(S^1)

description.en: Let G be a subgroup of the group Homeo+(S1) of orientation preserving homeomorphisms of the circle. An exotic circle of G is a subgroup of G which is topologically conjugate to SO(2) but not conjugate to SO(2) in G. The existence of an exotic circle shows us the fact that the subgroup G is far from being a Lie group. We previously proved that the group PL+(S1) of orientation preserving piecewise linear homeomorphisms of the circle has exotic circles. We give a more explicit construction of exotic circles of PL+(S1) and classify all exotic circles up to PL conjugacy. © 1997 by the University of Notre Dame. All rights reserved.
